pullRequest.body:
Let `N` be an integer.  Then there are only finitely many number fields (in some fixed extension of `‚Ñö`) of discriminant bounded in absolute value by `N`.

---

There is a bunch of this `TODO` that I don't understand.
I think these lines were added by @YaelDillies. I am not sure what to do about these, but removing the `attribute` does give a timeout.
(I also added these lines to a several functions that have the same problem).
#10131 has been merged, so if there is still a problem we should at least modify the comment.
Yes my refactor pushed a few unrelated things over the limit.
So what should I do about these messages. Change the text to say the problem is still there? Or try to fix it üòõ
Don't add any more todos, but leave the ones that are already there
Well, I have similar problems in some functions added by this PR, so I need to do something about those.
If you can fix them even better, but anyway I would remove (or say something more) the reference to #10131.

> Well, I have similar problems in some functions added by this PR, so I need to do something about those.

The point is that those similar problems have **not** been caused by #10131, so they should not reference it.

Actually, it was easier to solve that I expected (although I am not sure why it works). The problem was that Lean timed out trying to synthesize `OfNat (FractionalIdeal (‚Ü•(ùìû K))‚Å∞ K)À£ 1` but replacing `1` by `‚Üë1` does the trick.
We usually call this results `neg_mem` or something similar (since `symmetric` does not appear in the statement).
Good point. I changed it everywhere in the file.
Is this wanted? The statement is now `2 < ...`
Oops. I made a mistake while merging. Thanks!
Maybe `A` can be implicit, but as you prefer.
Yeah, I think I like it better if `A` is explicit
I don't understand the docstring, there is no `x` in the theorem.

Indeed. It should be `a`. 

Thanks for the review!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Proof of Hermite theorem on number fields of bounded discriminant
